title: How to Pass Time when You're Bored

steps.title: Listen to music.
steps.content: Listen to music. Listen to some old songs that you haven't listened to in a while. Even more enjoyable, spend time discovering new music you've never tried before, in new genres or from new bands. Use Genius, people's blog recommendations and YouTube to find new music to try.

steps.title: Watch a movie or two.
steps.content: Watch a movie or two. Watch a movie you haven't seen yet but want to see. Revisit an old favorite. You could also have a "bad movie day" and watch movies that seem interestingly stupid, and offer a commentary over the top of it (switch off the sound and run your own soundtrack -- have friends to help). Then you can rate your bad movies and see which was the absolute worst! [1] X Research source Make some popcorn. It'll be more fun to watch with a friend or family member.

steps.title: Make some funny clips or tutorial video (or DIY) with a friend.
steps.content: Make some funny clips or tutorial video (or DIY) with a friend. Then upload it to YouTube. Spend time with them chatting or shopping. See what the comments are and respond. Alternatively, watch YouTube videos. Try to watch at least two or more videos at a time. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Read a book.
steps.content: Read a book. If it's a nice day, read outside. If it's not nice enough outside, set up a reading nook indoors to pass the time comfortably. Choose a book that is of major interest to you, or switch between different books to spice things up. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Look up fan art of books and find your best ones.
steps.content: Look up fan art of books and find your best ones. For example, check out Percy Jackson, or the Hunger Games. Trade with friends so that you can find new interests.

steps.title: Send your long-distance friends a surprise.
steps.content: Send your long-distance friends a surprise. This might be a postcard, a handmade gift or something you know they have been wanting for a long time.

steps.title: Make some origami.
steps.content: Make some origami . It is always fun to learn a new skill!

steps.title: Play sweet and sour if it's good weather outside.
steps.content: Play sweet and sour if it's good weather outside. You simply stand by a road and when a car passes by, wave. If they wave back, yell "sweet!". If they don't, yell "sour!" and chase them down the road for a little while.

steps.title: Call over some friends for a few games or a talk.
steps.content: Call over some friends for a few games or a talk. Or do crazy stuff together, like pranks, running around or building a massive Minecraft structure. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Play a prank on a sibling or friend.
steps.content: Play a prank on a sibling or friend. Put Kool-Aid in the shower head, place Saran wrap under the toilet seat, put peanut butter underneath their car door handles and so on. See wikiHow's prank category for lots of fun ideas to inspire you.

steps.title: Take a walk.
steps.content: Take a walk. By yourself or with somebody. This can give you time to clear your mind and create different ideas. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the pool (as long as the weather permits).
steps.content: Go to the pool (as long as the weather permits). Swimming can be a fun time killer, and if it's really hot, you'll keep cool too.

steps.title: Get into the garden and do some gardening.
steps.content: Get into the garden and do some gardening. This is a great workout that will improve the garden as well. Plant a tree in your garden or make a place for the birds to feed and bathe. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Look up yoga routines.
steps.content: Look up yoga routines. Yoga can be a really good way to stretch, make sure try some poses you haven't tried before.

steps.title: Draw.
steps.content: Draw. Make a drawing or a cartoon or sketch. You could really see how your drawings have improved.

steps.title: Make up a short story.
steps.content: Make up a short story. Or maybe even a little book! Or, write an article for wikiHow.

steps.title: Make a quiz or an article for someone.
steps.content: Make a quiz or an article for someone.

steps.title: Play with chalk.
steps.content: Play with chalk. Admit it, everyone loves chalk. Find a large area of sidewalk and let your artistic self spill forth.

steps.title: Do some sort of art or craft.
steps.content: Do some sort of art or craft. Doodling can be fun. Grab some paints and start painting. Learn to knit or crochet. Build a bird feeder. Make a diorama or some hair accessories.

steps.title: Create a background on a plain wall using colorful curtains or buntings (you can also paint the wall new color if you're allowed to).
steps.content: Create a background on a plain wall using colorful curtains or buntings (you can also paint the wall new color if you're allowed to). Then take cool selfies with your friends. Upload those fun shots!

steps.title: Attempt to bake your own dish.
steps.content: Attempt to bake your own dish. Make it up from scratch and see how it turns out. It can always be turned into trifle if it fails. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Play a Musical Instrument.
steps.content: Play a Musical Instrument. Try playing a guitar, piano or violin which will develop your music skills.
